ko: 걔 새 차 사고 싶어 해.

He has a new car and an old car.
ko: 걔 새 차도 있고 헌 차도 있어.

en: He is pleased with his new car.
ko: 걔 새 차 마음에 들어 해.

en: He wants to get a new dictionary.
ko: 걔 새 사전 사고 싶어 해.

en: He is so crazy about his new car that he goes driving every Sunday.
ko: 걔 새 차에 너무 빠져서 일요일마다 드라이브 가.

en: He was eager to show off his new bicycle to his friends.
ko: 걔 친구들한테 새 자전거 엄청 자랑하고 싶어 했어.

en: He is going to buy a new bicycle.
He plans to buy a new bicycle.
He intends to buy a new bicycle.
He was eager to display his new bicycle to his friends.
ko: 걔 친구들한테 새 자전거 보여주려고 안달이었어.

en: He showed off his new watch.
He needed capital to start a new business.
ko: 걔 사업 새로 시작하려고 자본금이 필요했어.

en: He embarked on a new enterprise.
He absorbed new ideas.
He went to Tokyo for the purpose of getting a new job.
ko: 걔 새 직장 구하려고 도쿄에 갔어.

en: He was in a hurry to begin the new job.
ko: 걔 새 일 빨리 시작하려고 서둘렀어.

en: He's thrilled with his new job.
ko: 걔 새 직장 구해서 완전 신났어.

en: I'm sure he will make good in the new job.
ko: 걔라면 새 직장에서 분명히 잘 해낼 거야.

en: He will surely succeed in his new job.
ko: 걔는 새 직장에서 꼭 성공할 거야.

en: He didn't get on well in his new job.
ko: 걔 새 직장에서 잘 지내지 못했어.

en: It seems that he is happy with his new job.
ko: 걔 새 직장이 마음에 드나 봐.

en: He embarked on a new study.
He thought up a new idea.
He intends to bring out a new monthly magazine.
He lost himself in his new research.
He is working on the new plan.
ko: 걔 지금 새로운 계획 짜고 있어.

en: He engages himself in every new project.
He tried putting on his new shoes.
He bought a new pair of shoes.
He is pleased with his new shoes.
ko: 걔 새 신발 마음에 들어 해.

en: He operated the new machine.
He couldn't adapt to new circumstances.
ko: 걔는 새로운 환경에 적응을 못 하더라.

en: He tried to adapt himself to his new surroundings.
He is quick to adapt to new circumstances.
He quickly accustomed himself to his new surroundings.
He borrowed money from the bank to finance his home.
He built a new house.
He not only made the plan of a new house but built it himself.
ko: 새 집 설계만 한 게 아니라 직접 짓기까지 했어요.

en: He recently traded in his jeep for a new Mercedes.
ko: 최근에 지프차 팔고 새 벤츠로 바꿨어요.

en: He's getting on well in his new business.
ko: 새로 시작한 사업이 잘 되고 있어요.

en: He's always playing up to the boss, in hopes of getting a new PC in his office.
ko: 사무실에 새 컴퓨터 들여놓으려고 맨날 상사한테 아부해요.

en: I heard that he bought a new computer.
He employed a new maid.
He is full of new ideas.
He manifested his character in his behavior.
ko: 행동하는 걸 보면 성격이 다 드러나요.

en: He is very peculiar in his behavior.
ko: 그 사람은 행동하는 게 되게 특이해요.

en: He looked back and smiled at me.
He turned around and looked back.
He is a careful worker.
ko: 그 사람은 일을 되게 꼼꼼하게 해요.

en: He is a careful player.
He performed his duty with deliberation.
He has a doctor's degree in psychology.
He sat brooding over his troubles all day.
ko: 하루 종일 고민에 빠져서 앉아 있었어요.

en: His anxiety was such that he could hardly sleep.
ko: 너무 불안해서 잠도 거의 못 잤대요.

en: He is a good man at heart.
He died of a heart attack.
He is the foremost authority on heart surgery.
ko: 그분은 심장 수술 분야에서 최고의 권위자예요.

en: He has a bad heart.
He is sound in both mind and body.
He felt his heart beating fast.
He steeled himself against compassion.
ko: 동정심이 생기지 않게 마음을 단단히 먹었어요.

en: He read to his heart's content.
He enjoyed the vacation to his heart's content.
He sang to his heart's content.
His presence of mind deserted him.
He is kind at heart.
He welcomed the news from his heart.
He laughed a hearty laugh.
He turned over the matter in his mind.
He thought to himself, "No!" Aloud he said, "Yes."
He learned the poem by heart.
He could do nothing but give up his plan against his will.
ko: 어쩔 수 없이 내키지 않는 마음으로 계획을 포기했어요.

en: He'd better watch out, or Mulligan is going to wipe the floor with him.
ko: 조심하는 게 좋을 거예요, 안 그러면 멀리건한테 아주 박살 날 테니까요.

en: He is looked up to for his breadth of mind.
He greeted her with cordiality.
He came downstairs out of the bedroom for breakfast.
He rolled over in his sleep.
He turned over in bed.
He overslept himself.
He makes a point of doing ten push-ups before going to bed.
ko: 자기 전에 꼭 팔굽혀펴기를 열 번씩 해요.

en: He took a look at the newspaper before going to bed.
He glanced over the newspaper before turning in.
ko: 자러 가기 전에 신문을 대충 훑어봤어요.

en: He drank plenty of black coffee so as not to fall asleep.
He had to stay in bed.
Is he sleeping?
He went to bed.
He sat up all night reading a novel.
He stayed up all night reading a novel.
He sat up all night.
He stayed up all night.
He is a man whom we can trust.
He's a man we can trust.
He was respected as a hero because he defended his country against the invaders.
ko: 걔는 침략자들로부터 나라를 지켜서 영웅으로 존경받았어.

en: He is not a man to rely on.
I believe that he is a reliable man.
He is a reliable person and has a strong sense of responsibility.
He has a good name for reliability.
He is not a man to be trusted.
He can be trusted.
He can be relied on.
You can count on him.
He can be counted on.
He lost his honor.
He is a man to be trusted.
He cannot be trusted.
He can't be trusted.
He is a man of faith.
He is a man of strong faith.
He turned his tail and ran.
He is lazy.
He's lazy.
He has a good appetite.
He has a large store of food.
ko: 걔 먹을 거 엄청 많이 쟁여놨어.

en: He asked for food.
ko: 걔가 먹을 것 좀 달라고 하더라.

en: He sat at the head of the table.
He found a job with a food company.
He was always on the people's side.
He studies day and night.
He always wears dark glasses.
He was always on the side of the weak against the strong.
ko: 걔는 항상 약자 편에 서서 강자랑 맞섰어.

en: He hit the ball out of bounds.
ko: 걔가 친 공이 경기장 밖으로 나갔어.

en: He entertained us with jokes all evening.
ko: 걔가 저녁 내내 농담으로 우리를 즐겁게 해줬어.

en: He carried a joke too far.
He said so by way of a joke.
ko: 걔 농담 삼아 그렇게 말한 거야.

en: He said so only by way of a joke.
He did it just for fun.
When he saw the joke, he laughed in spite of himself.
ko: 걔는 농담인 걸 알고 자기도 모르게 웃었어.

en: He doesn't see a joke.
ko: 걔는 농담을 잘 이해 못 해.

en: He was brought up to riding.
ko: 걔는 어릴 때부터 말을 타고 자랐어.

en: He laughed at my joke.
He is good at riding a horse.
He is on board ship.
He is said to have been strong.
He belongs to the upper class.
He is in favor with his superiors.
He is in disfavour with his superiors.
He was made to work all day by the boss.
He was bare to the waist.
He hung his coat on a hook.
He had no coat on.
He took off his coat and put it on again.
He was reading a newspaper in his shirt sleeves.
He hung up his coat.
He took off his coat.
He noticed a hole in his jacket, but he tried to ignore it.
ko: 재킷에 구멍 난 거 봤는데 그냥 모르는 척하더라.

en: He zipped up his jacket.
He took a key from his coat pocket.
He burned a hole in his coat.
He speaks Japanese well, but I can't speak German.
ko: 걔 일본어 잘하는데 난 독일어 못해.

en: He speaks English well.
He can handle English well.
He can swim well.
He's good at swimming.
He handled the knife and fork very well.
He plays the guitar well.
He coaxed extra money from his mother.
ko: 걔 엄마한테 돈 좀 더 달라고 졸랐어.

en: He planned to murder his boss, but did not carry it out.
He cannot help accepting his boss's order.
ko: 상사 명령이라 어쩔 수 없이 따랐어.

en: He gets along badly with his boss.
He is not well-liked by his boss.
He made believe not to hear his boss.
ko: 걔 상사 말 못 들은 척했어.

en: He pretended not to hear his boss.
ko: 걔 상사 말 못 들은 척했어.

en: He attended the meeting in place of his boss.
He breathed deeply before entering his boss's office.
ko: 상사 사무실 들어가기 전에 숨 크게 들이마셨어.

en: He's in good odor with the chief.
He handed in his resignation to his boss.
He is always complaining about his boss.
He attempted to sidestep a conflict with his chief.
He knows better than to fight with his boss.
ko: 걔가 상사랑 싸울 정도로 바보는 아니지.

en: He is in with the boss.
He has his superiors' confidence.
He pretends to be enthusiastic when his boss is around.
ko: 걔 상사 있을 때만 열심히 하는 척해.

en: Whenever he comes up to Tokyo, he stays at our house.
ko: 걔 도쿄 올라올 때마다 우리 집에서 자.

en: Whenever he comes up to Tokyo, he stays with us.
ko: 걔 도쿄 올라올 때마다 우리 집에서 지내.

en: Every time he comes up to Tokyo, he never fails to call me up.
ko: 걔 도쿄 올 때마다 나한테 꼭 전화해.

en: He came up to Tokyo, and there married her.
He was in good spirits.
He was looking upward to the sky.
He deposited the prize money in the bank.
He boasted of having won the prize.
He didn't jump high enough to win a prize.
ko: 상 받을 정도로 높이 뛰지는 못했어.

en: He carved designs in ivory.
He explained it in detail.
He gave no further detail.
ko: 더는 자세히 말 안 해 주더라.

en: He was called to give evidence.
He was confronted with the evidence.
He cloaks his wickedness under a smiling face.
He was borne away by an impulse.
He greeted me with a smile.
He was afraid of being laughed at.
He tried to laugh her out of her foolish belief.
ko: 웃어넘기며 그 어리석은 생각을 고쳐주려 했어.

en: He laughed.
He does nothing but laugh.
It was all he could do not to laugh.
All he could do was resist laughing.
ko: 웃음을 참는 것밖에 할 수 없었어.

en: He was embarrassed.
He was made a fool of.
He played a hose on the burning hotel.
He made up his mind to be a fireman.
He has a passive character.
He called up his uncle on reaching Matsuyama.
He called up his uncle as soon as he got to Matsuyama.
He lived in Matsue for seven years.
He is angling for promotion.
He is out for promotion.
He is qualified for promotion.
He threw away his chance of promotion.
He is very reluctant to accept the invitation.
He withheld his consent.
He put his foot through the floor.
He looked down at the floor.
He was standing on the floor.
He lay at full length on the floor.
He dropped his books on the floor.
He fell down on the floor.
He collapsed on the floor.
He laid himself flat on the floor.
He was sitting on the floor.
As soon as he went to bed, he fell asleep.
He is confined to bed now.
He picked up a handkerchief from the floor.
He put a touch of salt on a boiled egg.
He was naughty when a boy.
He was naughty when he was a boy.
He was very naughty in his boyhood.
He seized the boy by the arm.
He was very naughty when he was a little boy.
He caught a boy stealing his watch.
He is a bit on the heavy side.
He has a knowledge of English.
He's a bit of a drunkard.
He took a glance at the girl.
He bent over the girl and kissed her.
He grouped the girls in three rows.
He washes his car at least once a week.
He pulls down at least twenty million yen a year.
ko: 그 사람은 일 년에 적어도 2천만 엔은 벌어.

en: He reads ten books a month at least.
ko: 그 사람은 한 달에 적어도 책을 열 권은 읽어.

en: He has at least one thousand books.
ko: 그 사람은 책이 적어도 천 권은 있어.

en: He has no less than five English books.
ko: 그 사람은 영어 책이 다섯 권이나 있어.

en: He has not a little interest in music.
ko: 그 사람은 음악에 관심이 꽤 많아.

en: He gave me what little money he had about him.
ko: 그 사람은 자기가 가진 얼마 안 되는 돈을 나한테 다 줬어.

en: He is a bit like his father.
He looks a bit tired, doesn't he?
ko: 그 사람 좀 피곤해 보이지 않아?

en: He looks a bit tired.
He seems to have a touch of fever.
ko: 그 사람 미열이 좀 있는 것 같아.

en: He left a while ago.
He's somewhat hard of hearing, so please speak louder.
ko: 그 사람이 귀가 좀 안 좋으니까 좀 더 크게 말해줘.

en: He arrived shortly after.
ko: 그 사람은 그 뒤에 곧 도착했어.

en: He continued his work after a short break.
ko: 그 사람은 잠깐 쉬고 나서 다시 일을 계속했어.

en: He said, "Let's take a short rest."
He suggested that we take a short rest.
He likes sports that have a touch of risk.
ko: 그 사람은 약간 위험한 스포츠를 좋아해.

en: He drank a little.
He grew no fatter.
ko: 그 사람은 전혀 살이 안 쪘어.

en: He shows no mark of progress.
ko: 그 사람은 나아진 기미가 전혀 안 보여.

en: He made no manifestation of his disappointment.
ko: 그 사람은 실망한 기색을 전혀 내비치지 않았어.

en: He didn't do a stitch of work.
ko: 그 사람은 손가락 하나 까딱 안 했어.

en: He didn't do any work.
ko: 그 사람은 일 하나도 안 했어.

en: He was not happy at all.
He is nothing of a scholar.
ko: 그 사람은 학자라고 할 것도 없어.

en: He is no kind of musician.
ko: 그 사람은 음악가라고 할 수준이 아니야.

en: He can't swim at all, but when it comes to skiing, he is the best.
ko: 그 사람은 수영은 아예 못하는데, 스키라면 최고야.

en: He is always on the move.
Is he anything of a scholar?
ko: 그 사람이 학자다운 면이 좀 있어?

en: He spoke with a suggestion of sarcasm in his voice.
ko: 그 사람 말투에 비꼬는 기색이 좀 있었어.

en: Is he anything like handsome?
He made the soup by mixing a little meat with some rice.
ko: 그 사람은 고기 약간이랑 밥을 섞어서 수프를 만들었어.

en: He will return if only a little.
He dug the hole bit by bit.
He has recovered little by little.
He recovered little by little.
He will get better little by little.
He is getting better bit by bit.
He saved money little by little, so that he could build a new house.
ko: 그 사람은 새 집을 지으려고 돈을 조금씩 모았어.

en: He sent out the parcel the day before yesterday.
He has a small frame.
He aimed at the bird.
He didn't dare to jump the brook.
ko: 그 사람은 감히 개울을 뛰어넘지 못했어.

en: He is two years older than Ogawa.
ko: 그 사람은 오가와보다 두 살 더 많아.

en: He is a novelist and artist.
He won fame as a novelist.
He is known to us all as a novelist.
ko: 그 사람은 우리 모두에게 소설가로 알려져 있어.

en: He is a critic rather than a novelist.
I think he is not so much a novelist as he is a scholar.
ko: 내 생각에 그 사람은 소설가라기보다 학자에 가까워.

en: He is a novelist and poet.
He sat down to read a novel.
He is writing a novel.
He prefers poetry to fiction.
He is now writing a sister volume to his novel.
ko: 걔 지금 소설 자매편 쓰고 있어.

en: He signed the check.
He tied the twigs into bundles.
He bound twigs in faggots.
He tied the small branches into a bundle.
ko: 걔가 작은 나뭇가지들을 한 묶음으로 묶었어.

en: He had an old pickup truck and a big, battered mower.
ko: 걔 낡은 픽업트럭 한 대랑 크고 낡은 잔디깎이 기계가 있었어.

en: He took her cubs, and ran up the mountain without looking back.
ko: 걔가 새끼들을 낚아채서 뒤도 안 보고 산으로 뛰어 올라갔어.

en: He is a primary school teacher, so he is used to dealing with children.
ko: 걔 초등학교 선생님이라 애들 다루는 거에 익숙해.

en: He is in fourth grade of elementary school.
He saved a little boy from drowning.
ko: 걔가 물에 빠진 어린 남자애를 구했어.

en: He grew up in a little village.
He is sailing a little boat on the water.
ko: 걔 물 위에서 작은 배를 타고 있어.

en: He made a small dog house.
He keeps a small poultry yard.
He was able to build a small house.
ko: 걔는 작은 집 한 채 지을 수 있었어.

en: He came across the Atlantic in a small sailboat.
ko: 걔 작은 요트를 타고 대서양을 건너왔어.

en: He crossed the river in a small boat.
ko: 걔 작은 배를 타고 강을 건넜어.

en: He is too young to go swimming alone.
ko: 걔 혼자 수영하러 가기엔 너무 어려.

en: He has a large desk in his small room.
ko: 걔 작은 방에 큰 책상이 있어.

en: He's adept at jumping into profitable niches.
ko: 걔는 돈 되는 틈새시장에 뛰어드는 데 선수야.

en: He was small, but strong.
He is a promising young businessman.
I think of him as a promising journalist.
He is a potential leader.
He wants to be a scientist in the future.
ko: 걔 나중에 과학자가 되고 싶어 해.

en: He wants to be a doctor in the future.
ko: 걔 나중에 의사가 되고 싶어 해.

en: He staked his future on this single chance.
ko: 걔는 이 한 번의 기회에 미래를 걸었어.

en: He will be a Shakespeare in the future.
ko: 걔 나중에 셰익스피어 같은 사람이 될 거야.

en: He wants to become a cook in the future.
ko: 걔 나중에 요리사가 되고 싶어 해.

en: He wants to be an Edison in the future.
ko: 걔 나중에 에디슨 같은 사람이 되고 싶어 해.

en: He'll have many hardships to go through in the future.
ko: 걔 앞으로 겪어야 할 고생이 많을 거야.

en: He wants to be a policeman in the future.
ko: 걔 나중에 경찰이 되고 싶어 해.

en: He hopes to run a company in the future.
ko: 걔 나중에 회사 경영하고 싶어 해.

en: He will be a Newton in the future.
ko: 걔 나중에 뉴턴 같은 사람이 될 거야.

en: He is likely to win the scholarship.
He studied on a scholarship.
He studied hard with a view to gaining a scholarship.
ko: 걔 장학금 타려고 진짜 열심히 공부했어.

en: He traveled on business.
He went to Tokyo on business.
He is absent on business in Osaka.
ko: 걔 오사카 출장 중이라 지금 없어.

en: He's not here because he's on a business trip to Osaka.
ko: 걔 오사카 출장 중이라 여기 없어.

en: He's out of the office because he's in Osaka on business.
ko: 걔 오사카 출장 가서 자리 비웠어.

en: Business carried him to Kobe.
He came up to Tokyo on business.
He went there on business.
He often goes abroad on business.
ko: 걔 일 때문에 해외 자주 나가.

en: He went to New York on business.
He set up in business.
He is planning to develop his business.
He wants to engage in business.
He sold his business and retired.
He is the last person to succeed in business.
ko: 그 사람은 사업에 성공할 사람이 절대 아니야.

en: He is still green in business.
He has experience in business.
He made good in business.
His failure in business compelled him to sell his house.
Business absorbs all his time.
His business has come to a standstill.
He employed dishonest means in his business.
He could not make it in business.
He is not aggressive enough to succeed in business.
He rejoiced at the successful business transaction.
ko: 사업 거래가 잘 돼서 되게 좋아하더라고.

en: He is able in business.
He is in business.
He is rich enough to keep a servant.
He bragged of having won the victory.
He burned for his moment of triumph.
It looks like he will win.
He voiced his opinion with reckless abandon.
He flatters himself he will win.
If he wins he will gain self-confidence.
He hopes he'll win and I hope so too.
Do you doubt that he will win?
He said he would win and he did, too.
He is sure of winning.
He had his wounds dressed.
He made believe not to be hurt.
He pretended not to be hurt.
He gradually recovered his temper.
He gradually came to love his father.
He is getting used to this rural life by degrees.
He married an actress.
He is a hen-pecked husband.
He looks down on women.
He's the kind of guy who doesn't take women seriously.
He doesn't approve of women smoking.
ko: 여자가 담배 피우는 걸 안 좋아해.

en: He is only too pleased to be advised by a woman.
He disguised himself as a woman.
He had a gentleness that was attractive to women.
He is a woman hater.
He teaches in a girls' high school.
He had a prejudice against women drivers.
He bowed to the Queen.
He was given three ships by the queen.
He has no eye for women.
He watched the girls playing tennis.
He's just showing off in front of the girls.
ko: 여자애들 앞에서 그냥 허세 부리는 거야.

en: He's always chasing girls.
He rescued a girl from drowning and was given a reward.
ko: 걔는 물에 빠진 여자를 구해주고 보상금을 받았어.

en: Women didn't care for him.
He placed great belief in his assistant.
He trusts his assistant quite a lot.
ko: 걔는 자기 비서를 꽤 많이 믿어.

en: He can look to his uncle for advice.
ko: 걔는 삼촌한테 조언을 구할 수 있어.

en: He has no friends to advise him.
ko: 걔는 조언해 줄 친구가 한 명도 없어.

en: He gave me not only advice but also money.
ko: 걔는 나한테 조언뿐만 아니라 돈도 줬어.

en: He called for help.
He heard a cry for help.
He cried out for help in a loud voice.
He asked for help.
He requested help.
He has only to ask for help.
ko: 걔는 그냥 도움을 청하기만 하면 돼.

en: He didn't come to help, but to hinder us.
ko: 걔는 도와주러 온 게 아니라 우리를 방해하러 온 거야.

en: He gave a loud cry for help.
He shouted for help.
He yelled for help.
He deposited his papers with his lawyer.
He read the document aloud.
ko: 걔는 그 서류를 소리 내어 읽었어.

en: He folded his paper, consulting his watch.
He dumped the papers back into the drawer.
ko: 걔는 서류들을 다시 서랍에 확 집어넣었어.

en: He took a glance at the papers.
He finished sorting the papers.
He didn't even look over the papers.
He was forced to sign the document.
ko: 걔는 억지로 그 서류에 서명해야 했어.

en: He showed little interest in books or music.
ko: 걔는 책이나 음악에 별로 관심이 없었어.

en: He told the bookstore keeper that he would come there again to buy the book that afternoon.
ko: 걔는 서점 주인한테 그날 오후에 책을 사러 다시 오겠다고 말했어.

en: He bought a number of books at the bookstore.
ko: 걔는 서점에서 책을 여러 권 샀어.

en: He closeted himself in his study.
He is in his library.
He can't even read, let alone write.
He earns his bread as a writer.
He makes a living as a writer.
He earns his living by writing.

ko: 걔는 글을 쓸 때 항상 곁에 사전을 둬.

en: He went around the neighborhood collecting signatures.

He was affected by the heat.

en: Although he is elderly, he looks young.
His maiden work established his reputation.
He made his mark as a writer with his very first novel.
ko: 걔는 첫 소설로 작가로서 이름을 알렸어.

en: He is on a roll.
He has played his card out of turn.
ko: 걔가 차례도 아닌데 너무 앞서서 수를 썼어.

en: He will graduate from university in 2001 if things go well.

en: He rose to the rank of sergeant.
He's a genuine aristocrat.
He failed in the examination for lack of preparation.
ko: 걔는 준비를 안 해서 시험에서 떨어졌어.

en: He attached great importance to the event.
ko: 걔는 그 사건을 아주 중요하게 생각했어.

en: He tried to keep dry as best he could.
He tried his best not to get wet.
He played the game as best he could.
ko: 할 수 있는 한 최선을 다해 게임을 했어.

en: He has powerful connections in the publishing industry.
He is in the publishing business.

He put off his departure till Sunday.

He decided he would put off his departure.
He decided to put off his departure.
He decided to postpone his departure.
He advanced his departure by two days.
He got ready for departure.
He was about to start.
He was laughed at by all the people present.
ko: 거기 있던 사람들한테 다 비웃음을 샀어.

en: He was absent at roll call.
His attendance is irregular.
He said under oath that he was born in Italy.
He said under oath that his birthplace was Italy.
He wants to advance in the world.
His career culminated in the presidency.
He doesn't seem to want to get ahead.
ko: 별로 출세하고 싶은 마음이 없나 봐.

en: He flirts with every woman he meets.
He shouted, "Get out!"

All of a sudden, he proposed to me.
He stayed at home all day instead of going out.
ko: 외출하는 대신 하루 종일 집에 있었어.

en: He was welcomed wherever he went.
He is a proficient pianist.
He enjoys a good reputation as a specialist in brain surgery.
ko: 뇌 수술 전문가로 평판이 아주 좋아.

en: He is an adept climber.
He studies at a cram school.

It took him two hours to finish his homework.
ko: 숙제 끝내는 데 두 시간 걸렸어.

en: After he had finished his homework, he went out for a walk.

en: He must finish his homework today.
ko: 오늘까지 숙제 무조건 다 끝내야 해.

en: He was busy with his homework.
He overlooked his assignment.

He is accustomed to hard work.
He is a person of importance.
He played an important part.
He made an important scientific discovery.

en: He is suffering from a serious illness.

ko: 그는 위독해서 회복하기 힘들 것 같아요.

en: They say that he is seriously ill.

ko: 많이 아팠는데 지금은 건강이 좋아지고 있어요.

en: He committed a serious crime.
He made an important discovery.

He made a grave mistake.
He has made a significant decision.

en: He was seriously ill, and the doctor was sent for.

en: He made a little statue out of soft clay.

en: He departed from the old custom.

He treats his employees well.
He is inaccessible to his employees.
He is well able to read.

en: He refused my offer for no good reason.

en: He does not study hard enough.

en: He will be back in ten minutes.
He'll be back in ten.

He's quite able at his job.

en: I saw him after ten years.

He's very likely to come.

en: He left high school at seventeen.

He crossed himself.

en: He changed his address.
He had no house to live in.
He's looking for a place to live.
He lives in a little cozy house.
He lives in a cozy little house.
He had to address the meeting.

en: He asked me to keep him company on the weekends.

en: He is going to stay with his uncle for the weekend.

en: He often stays away from home on the weekend.

en: He plays golf on weekends.
He is paid by the week.

ko: 걔 일주일에 며칠 일 안 해서 돈도 거의 못 벌어.

en: He works beyond office hours twice a week.

ko: 걔 일주일에 며칠 일하고 돈 조금 받아.

en: He writes me once a week.
ko: 걔 일주일에 한 번씩 나한테 편지 써.

en: He wrestled his attacker to the ground.
He is conservative in his habits.
He may have missed the last train.
He was released from prison immediately after the war.

en: Before retiring he usually dumps the chicken feed from all his pockets onto the table.

en: Before going to bed, he usually takes all the coins from his pockets and dumps them on the table.

en: He declined the job-offer very politely.
He grabbed the chance to get a job.
He's old enough to go to school.
He has no religious mind.

en: He is too much superior to those about him to be quickly understood.

en: He looked around.
He lives beyond his income.

en: He tried to make both ends meet.
He lives up to his income.

en: He had his head in the clouds in class.

en: He did not enjoy his lessons.

en: He succeeded in entering the university.

en: He committed suicide by hanging himself.

en: He refrained from drinking too much.
He is drunk.

He's giving himself up to drink.

He tried many different methods.

He likes hunting.

en: He listened to his CDs at random.

en: He answered in brief.

He decided to have the operation.

en: He had been writing a letter.

en: He put a stamp on the letter.

en: He had three pieces of baggage.

en: He had a little piano on wheels, and a poor thin monkey which sat on top of it.

en: He made a lot of easy money.
ko: 그는 아주 쉽게 돈을 많이 벌었어요.

en: He warmed his hands.

He helped an old lady get up from her seat.

en: He reached for the book.

en: He reached out his hand for the knife, but it was too far away.

en: He was chosen captain.
